title.value: Development of a hydrated electron dosimeter for radiotherapy applications: A proof of concept
title.justification: The title explicitly mentioned in the paper such as in the DOI reference section.
title.quote: How to cite this article: Mégrourèche J, Bekerat H, Bian J, et al. Development of a hydrated electron dosimeter for radiotherapy applications: A proof of concept. Med Phys. 2023;

extractions.description: This paper explores the development and proof-of-concept of a hydrated electron dosimeter for use in clinical radiotherapy applications. It investigates how hydrated electrons, which increase the optical absorption of water, can be utilized to create dosimeters that are near-tissue-equivalent. The study measures the optical absorption associated with hydrated electrons produced by clinical linear accelerators and assesses the technique's suitability for radiotherapy applications.

type.justification: The study involves practical experiments and collection of empirical data to measure hydrated electron optical absorption, which indicates an empirical approach.
type.quote: The aims of this study were to measure the optical absorption associated with hydrated electrons produced by clinical linacs and to assess the suitability of the technique for radiotherapy applications.

name.justification: The research is centered around the development of dosimeters for radiotherapy, which is a significant domain within Medical Physics.
name.quote: This suggests that our prototype represents a viable pathway toward e^{-}aq dosimetry for clinical radiotherapy applications...

name.justification: The research focuses on developing dosimeters for radiotherapy applications, directly connecting it to the field of radiotherapy.
name.quote: ...we observed absorption transients consistent with hydrated electrons generated by clinical linac radiation. The agreement between our inferred dose and EBT3 film measurements suggests this proof of concept system represents a viable pathway toward tissue-equivalent dosimeters for clinical radiotherapy applications.

name.justification: The study involves the measurement of absorbed doses using a developed dosimeter, making it relevant to dosimetry research.
name.quote: Measurement or evaluation of the absorbed dose imparted by ionizing radiation in a medium is accomplished by a radiation dosimeter also called a radiation detector.

name.justification: The paper describes the use of EBT3 radiochromic film measurements for comparison with the developed dosimeter measurements, categorizing it as a used dataset.
name.quote: To confirm the accuracy of the absorbed dose obtained with the e^{-}aq dosimeter, EBT3 radiochromic film measurements were acquired.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reference radiochromic film dosimetry: review of technical aspects.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references a work for technical aspects of radiochromic film dosimetry, likely providing foundational or comparative insights for the use of EBT3 film in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Devic S, Tomic N, Lewis D. Reference radiochromic film dosimetry: review of technical aspects. Physica Med. 2016

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of MATLAB for data analysis, indicating its role in the data processing pipeline of the study.
name.quote: The data were collected on a computer with an in-house MATLAB program.

referenced_paper_title.justification: MATLAB is a commonly used mathematical software and its use is usually general knowledge; hence it might not be specifically cited in the references.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The data were collected on a computer with an in-house MATLAB program.
